oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Eliza H. Spalding to Lorena Hart, April 4, 1834.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Spalding, Henry Harmon, 1803-1874.
Spalding, Eliza Hart, 1807-1851.
oai_dc:dc.dc:coverage: North and Central America--United States--New York--Oneida--Holland Patent
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Henry Harmon Spalding and Eliza Hart Spalding Papers, 1833-ca. 1908.--http://www.history.pcusa.org/collections/research-tools/guides-archival-collections/rg-283
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Hart, Lorena.
Drury, Clifford Merrill, 1897-1984.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from Mrs. H.H. Spalding, April 4, 1834 with a note from Mr. Spalding added March 31, 1834, while Mr. Spalding was a student in the Theological Seminary at Cincinnati. References are made to their life, finances, etc. Addressed to Miss Lorena Hart, Holland Patent. Eliza makes mention of studying Greek and Hebrew; of attending missionary meetings, etc. [Caption transcribed from Clifford M. Drury's notes.]
